attributes.action: CCTV to be mandatory in all UK abattoirs with independent 24 hr monitoring.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa May asserted that CCTV in abattoirs was sufficient to protect animals.  There is no legislation for CCTV in Scotland, Wales and NI.  Abattoirs are required to keep footage for 90 days and make images available for government inspectors however we have no information regarding how much footage is monitored or whether abuse has led to prosecution
attributes.background: CCTV is only mandatory in England,  This should be extended to all the UK with independent monitoring of all slaughter to ensure that animals are not allowed to recover after stunning, to prevent ineffective stunning and to ensure that animals are not cruelly treated

rejection.details:
Your petition is about an issue that is devolved. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

The Welsh Assembly also has its own Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Welsh Assembly, you can find out more here:

http://www.assembly.wales/en/gethome/e-petitions/Pages/e-petitions.aspx
